skill.name: frontend-design
skill.description: Create distinctive, production-grade frontend interfaces with high design quality. Use this skill when the user asks to build web components, pages, artifacts, posters, or applications (examples include websites, landing pages, dashboards, React components, HTML/CSS layouts, or when styling/beautifying any web UI). Generates creative, polished code and UI design that avoids generic AI aesthetics.

Create distinctive, bold aesthetic directions tailored to project context
Design interfaces with exceptional typography, color theory, and spatial composition
Build responsive, accessible web components and pages
Apply creative visual details like gradients, textures, and atmospheric effects

limitations: Requires clear context about purpose, audience, and technical constraints for best results
May need iteration to align creative vision with user preferences

use_cases.title: Portfolio Websites

prompt_templates.title: Landing Page with Specific Aesthetic
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a landing page for [product/service] targeting [audience]. Use a [brutalist/minimalist/retro-futuristic/etc.] aesthetic with [specific color preferences]. The page should emphasize [key message] and include [specific sections like hero, features, CTA].
prompt_templates.scenario: When you need a landing page with a specific design direction and brand alignment

prompt_templates.title: Component with Context
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a [component type] for a [type of application] that [purpose]. The design should feel [desired tone/aesthetic]. Technical requirements: [framework, constraints].
prompt_templates.scenario: When creating reusable components that need to fit a larger design system

prompt_templates.title: Dashboard Design
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a dashboard for [user role] to monitor [data/metrics]. The interface should prioritize [key information] and support [user actions]. Create a [aesthetic direction] design that makes complex data approachable.
prompt_templates.scenario: When building data visualization interfaces that need both function and form

prompt_templates.title: Full Application Interface
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a [type of application] that helps users [primary goal]. Target audience is [user description]. Design constraints: [technical requirements]. I want the aesthetic to be completely unexpected and memorable.
prompt_templates.scenario: When building complete applications from scratch with creative freedom

output_examples.input: Create a landing page for an AI writing tool targeting creative writers. Use a warm, editorial aesthetic.
output_examples.output: Production-ready HTML/CSS/JS code featuring: serif display typography (like Crimson Pro), warm earth-tone palette with cream backgrounds and terracotta accents, magazine-style asymmetric layout with generous white space, subtle paper texture overlays, elegant fade-in animations for content sections, and sophisticated micro-interactions on CTAs.

output_examples.input: Build a React dashboard for monitoring server metrics with a brutalist aesthetic.
output_examples.output: React component code with: monospace typography (like JetBrains Mono), stark black/white/red color scheme, raw grid layouts with visible borders, no-nonsense data tables, harsh geometric shapes, zero decorative elements, and instant state changes without smooth transitions.

best_practices: Provide clear context about purpose, audience, and tone to enable better aesthetic decisions
Specify technical constraints upfront (framework, browser support, performance requirements)
Request specific aesthetic directions if you have preferences (minimalist, maximalist, retro, etc.)
Ask for iterations on specific elements rather than complete redesigns
Share examples of designs you like or dislike to guide the creative direction
Be open to bold creative choices that may differ from conventional patterns
Test generated code in your target environment and provide feedback on technical issues
anti_patterns: Requesting 'modern and clean' without specificity (leads to generic results)
Not providing context about users or purpose
Asking for designs that copy existing popular websites exactly
Expecting pixel-perfect match to a reference without sharing the reference
Requesting contradictory aesthetic directions (minimal AND maximalist)
Omitting technical constraints that affect implementation
Rejecting creative choices without explaining why they don't work for your context

faq.question: What makes this different from asking Claude to build a website normally?
faq.answer: This skill applies opinionated design thinking focused on creating distinctive, memorable interfaces that avoid generic AI aesthetics. It emphasizes bold creative choices, sophisticated typography, intentional color theory, and cohesive aesthetic execution rather than defaulting to safe, common patterns.

faq.question: Can I use this for production applications?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill generates production-grade code. However, you should review for accessibility, test across browsers/devices, and ensure it meets your specific technical and business requirements before deploying.

faq.question: What if I don't like the aesthetic direction chosen?
faq.answer: Provide feedback on what doesn't work for your context and suggest alternative directions. The skill is designed to iterate based on your input and constraints.

faq.question: Does this work with specific frameworks like Next.js or Vue?
faq.answer: Yes, you can specify your framework and technical requirements. The skill adapts to generate appropriate code for your stack.

faq.question: Will every design be maximalist or over-the-top?
faq.answer: No. The skill matches implementation complexity to the aesthetic vision. Refined minimalism and bold maximalism are both valid directions - the key is intentional execution rather than defaulting to safe middle-ground designs.

faq.question: Can I get just the HTML/CSS without JavaScript?
faq.answer: Yes, specify your technical constraints. The skill can generate pure HTML/CSS solutions or include JavaScript/framework code based on your needs.
